channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9328] Table web UI is corrupted sometime
item.description:
The web UI page source is like below:

<h2>Table Attributes</h2>

<table class="table table-striped">

  <tr>

      <th>Attribute Name</th>

      <th>Value</th>

      <th>Description</th>

  </tr>

  <tr>

      <td>Enabled</td>

      <td>true</td>

      <td>Is the table enabled</td>

  </tr>

  <tr>

      <td>Compaction</td>

      <td>







<p><hr/></p>

No sure if it is a HBase issue, or a network/browser issue.
item.summary: Table web UI is corrupted sometime

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I faced that few times too with 0.94. When you start big splits or things like that... I guess I can reproduce it.

Here you go:


<h2>Table Attributes</h2>

<table>

  <tr>

      <th>Attribute Name</th>

      <th>Value</th>

      <th>Description</th></tr>

  <tr>

      <td>Enabled</td>

      <td>true</td>

      <td>Is the table enabled</td>

  </tr>

  <tr>

      <td>Compaction</td>

      <td>







<p><hr><p>

Actions:

Reproduced.

I will look at it this evening.


org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.NotServingRegionException: Region is not online: tree,2moc.sulpdranac.www,1377298548742.0dc8de33fca01dd334d8dd6f0068b0f4.

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.getRegion(HRegionServer.java:3511)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.getCompactionState(HRegionServer.java:4127)

	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor18.invoke(Unknown Source)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient.call(HBaseClient.java:998)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HBaseAdmin.getCompactionState(HBaseAdmin.java:1905)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.generated.master.table_jsp._jspService(table_jsp.java:171)

	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:98)

	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1212)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.handle(ServletHandler.java:399)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.security.SecurityHandler.handle(SecurityHandler.java:216)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.SessionHandler.handle(SessionHandler.java:182)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandler.handle(ContextHandler.java:766)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext.handle(WebAppContext.java:450)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandlerCollection.handle(ContextHandlerCollection.java:230)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:152)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.Server.handle(Server.java:326)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handleRequest(HttpConnection.java:542)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection$RequestHandler.headerComplete(HttpConnection.java:928)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseNext(HttpParser.java:549)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseAvailable(HttpParser.java:212)

	at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:404)

	at org.mortbay.io.nio.SelectChannelEndPoint.run(SelectChannelEndPoint.java:410)

	at org.mortbay.thread.QueuedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:582)

Here is a proposal. We have the details in the message. So I used that to detect the exception and ignore it. Tested on 0.94.

To reproduce, on the WebUI, split the table, come back on the table details view and refresh again and again. The more region you have, the more "changes" you have to see the issue.
You may want to use e.getCause, and use instanceof to check if it is the expected exception. However, the ui will be broken too if there are other exceptions, right? What can do for that?

I tried getCause but I got NULL only Only the message was not NULL, that's why I used it.

I can also modify the UI to display "Unkown" on the status cell if we get any other exception?
I see. The trunk may be different. Some error message like "Unknown" or "Try it again later" sounds good to me. I was wondering if we can log the exception somewhere, which may help debugging.

The exception was already there in the .out file. That's where I found it. I will "simply" printStackTrace it from the JSP if we get one, and display "Unknown". I will have to re-introduce the error to be able to test it But I can't test it in trunk yet
Something like that should do the job... I tested it in 0.94 only. But code seems to be exactly the same in trunk...

Tested HBASE-9328-v2-0.94.patch locally:
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 22:10.565s
[INFO] Finished at: Thu Sep 12 07:27:35 EDT 2013
[INFO] Final Memory: 66M/528M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

Jean-Marc Spaggiari So, how does this work? It just catches this one exception? What about any others? Was the exception not being printed to the screen? If not, should we be printing it? I'd be fine committing t his if it works for you. We can deal w/ the rest in separate issue.

Hi stack, thanks for looking at it.

Basically, getCompactionStatein HBaseAdmin call the RS using ProtoBuff to get the compaction state. The RS will return a NotServingRegionException if required, but it's then encapsulated into a RemoteException. Then the catch (NotServingRegionException e) will not catch it. It need to be catch into a catch (RemoteException e). It's what I'm doing here.

If there is any other exception, then it will call throw e; to be consistent with the current behaviour, and this will be catch on the JSP side which will do a printStackTrace. So at the end, this will be logged into the .out file like it was before, but now that will display a nice "unknow" for the state instead of corrupting the interface.

Before this patch, when an expection occured, UI got corrupted and exception was logged into the .out file. After this patch, when an exception occurs, the UI is no more corrupted and it will show "Unknown" for the state. Also if the server is not serving the region, it will confirm that it's also not compacting.
Committed to trunk and 0.96. We need this in 0.94 Jean-Marc Spaggiari?
Might be good to have it on 0.94. Lars Hofhansl, are you good with that? I can provide the path. The import is a bit different for 0.94.

Hey, I agree. It's not very good to look at the message to get the exception.

Ok. Give me some time. I will take a look and see if there is another way to do that. Like unwrapRemoteException or anything else. I'll be back.

Ok. So here is the situation for this patch.

Java code need to be updated for both trunk and 0.94, but not with the same content.
JSP code has been updated in trunk but not in 0.94.

So I will provide one addendum for trunk, and one patch for 0.94.
Was missing this small addendum for Trunk to complete the patch. Sorry.
Patch for 0.94 attached.
Lars Hofhansl we should be good now
Re-resolving.
This has not been fully applied. I don't think it's really fixed. Issue is still there.
We should not have commits to trunk and various branches without resolution of the issue.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
